replies.body:
So I'm guessing you've already had a 14 day ban? The next punishment after a 14 day ban is a permanent ban.

The rules of chat basically allow no negativity. You cant argue with people. You cant call for reports against someone, as 1 report has the same effect as 9. You cant insult anyone (Implied someone is an idiot, called them racist, called them rude). I know you had reasons for all this, you dont just go around accusing people for no reason. But, according to Riot's rules, it is never justified to argue with people or insult them. They expect you to mute when you have a problem with someone's chat. Instead of muting, you brought shit to all chat and argued and complained in all of your chat. Literally all of it is either arguing or complaining. So next time, if you do make a new account, you should just mute, report if you want, and move on. Theres no reason to take that abuse when muting stops it all.

If I were you, I would attempt to get the punishment lowered by filing a support ticket. Ask for a second look, as your chat isnt offensive, its just excessive arguing and derailing focus from the game.

I realize that but why should it be okay for everyone else to say whatever they want but I can't even defend myself. Without cussing at anyone or insulting anyone. And I asked them to be reported because they shouldn't be allowed to get away with what the did to me all game.

It isn't. You get punished because you consistently break the rules even after multiple warnings. If they consistently break the rules, they will get the same punishments you were subjected to.

Further, more reports does not make punishment more likely.

i know that i have broken the rules in the past. that's fine and i'm not trying to belittle that. what's the issue here is that IN THIS CASE i didn't do anything to ANYONE to be banned for. It's not against the rules to say cuss words. I didn't cuss anyone out. I didn't tell anyone to go kys or anything offensive at all.

You called for reports (harassment), you argued, and the majority of your log was you ragging on your teammates.

No, it's not against the rules to cuss. But all three of those things are.

How that is raging?!?!? I was literally just defending myself for people harassing me. You can only see my part of the conservation not what these people were saying/doing to me for me to respond that way.

It does not matter what they were doing. Your punishment is based on your behavior. As an analogy, if someone starts throwing shit on a public sidewalk, everyone may join in, but that doesn't make any of them okay, and someone still has to clean it up.

You can defend yourself by muting, not by arguing in the chat.

You, Teemo, Lucian, and Swain weren't the only ones in that game, there was 6 other people, 1 of them being on your own team. There was no reason for you to keep stoking the fire and making that one players experience even worse, or making the enemy teams experience worse if anything was brought into all chat.

If you decide to make a new account then you need to mute, report, move on. Don't sit there arguing or calling for reports.

Its not okay for them to do it, and its not okay to join in and exacerbate the situation when someone else does it. What gives you the idea its okay? Because you're not allowed to talk back?

From your duplicate thread:

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=yrc23zHg,discussion-id=2K2dxqN1,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-07-10T04:47:57.797+0000)
>
> You advertised your stream (I'm pretty sure your teammates are busy), then said something positive, then announced your intent to report and it was all downhill from there. The rest of your chat consisted of talking about reports, calling for reports, announcing your intent to forfeit, spamming question marks, calling a teammate an idiot, more calling for reports, useless arguing, and more calling for reports.
> 
> You're not permabanned for one game with inappropriate chat. You're permabanned for _one more_ game with inappropriate chat, after having been warned about it before. When you got a 14-day suspension from 6/18 to 7/2, you were very specifically told that your account was on thin ice. A week after being allowed to play again, you behaved like this. The chat feature is intended as a means to foster teamwork and encourage communication so you and your teammates can coordinate your gameplay and win games. It is not intended as a platform for you to scream at people and harass them, which is what you used it for.

Also:

0. Everyone else's behavior isn't in question here. Only yours is.
0. You did engage in bannable behavior. See my quoted post above.
0. The only available self-defense from being harassed in chat is to mute the offending player. It is 100% effective. Calling for reports, useless arguing, etc. are 0% effective on top of being misbehavior that Riot punishes.
It's clear that this company supports cyber bullying and care more about banning people for trying to get said cyber bullies punished for their behavior versus the one being harassed.

You will never get punished for reporting, which is how you try to get bullies punished.

The things you did in this log did absolutely nothing to help get others punished for bullying. More reports do not cause punishment faster or more likely.
